017package org.apache.juneau.commons.collections;
018
019import static org.apache.juneau.commons.utils.AssertionUtils.*;
020
021import java.util.*;
022
023/**
024 * A sorted list implementation backed by an {@link ArrayList}.
025 *
026 * <p>
027 * Unlike {@link TreeSet}, this class allows duplicate elements and maintains them in sorted order
028 * according to a specified {@link Comparator} or natural ordering. All modification operations
029 * (add, set, etc.) automatically maintain the sorted order.
030 *
031 * <p>
032 * This implementation uses an {@link ArrayList} internally, providing:
033 * <ul>
034 *    <li>Fast random access (O(1) for get operations)
035 *    <li>Efficient binary search for finding insertion points (O(log n))
036 *    <li>Array shifting for insertions (O(n))
037 * </ul>
038 *
039 * <p>
040 * For better insertion performance with large lists, consider using {@link SortedLinkedList}.
041 *
042 * <h5 class='section'>Features:</h5>
043 * <ul class='spaced-list'>
044 *    <li>Maintains elements in sorted order automatically
045 *    <li>Allows duplicate elements (unlike {@link TreeSet})
046 *    <li>Efficient insertion using binary search (O(log n) to find position, O(n) to insert)
047 *    <li>Fast random access (O(1) for get operations)
048 *    <li>Supports custom comparators or natural ordering
049 * </ul>
050 *
051 * <h5 class='section'>Performance Characteristics:</h5>
052 * <ul class='spaced-list'>
053 *    <li><b>add(E)</b>: O(n) - binary search to find position + array shift
054 *    <li><b>get(int)</b>: O(1) - direct array access
055 *    <li><b>contains(Object)</b>: O(log n) - binary search
056 *    <li><b>remove(Object)</b>: O(n) - binary search + array shift
057 *    <li><b>set(int, E)</b>: O(n) - may need to re-sort if element order changes
058 * </ul>
059 *
060 * <h5 class='section'>Usage:</h5>
061 * <p class='bjava'>
062 *    <jc>// Natural ordering</jc>
063 *    SortedArrayList&lt;String&gt; <jv>list</jv> = <jk>new</jk> SortedArrayList&lt;&gt;();
064 *    <jv>list</jv>.add(<js>"c"</js>);
065 *    <jv>list</jv>.add(<js>"a"</js>);
066 *    <jv>list</jv>.add(<js>"b"</js>);
067 *    <jc>// list contains: ["a", "b", "c"]</jc>
068 *
069 *    <jc>// Custom comparator</jc>
070 *    SortedArrayList&lt;String&gt; <jv>list2</jv> = <jk>new</jk> SortedArrayList&lt;&gt;(Comparator.comparing(String::length));
071 *    <jv>list2</jv>.add(<js>"ccc"</js>);
072 *    <jv>list2</jv>.add(<js>"a"</js>);
073 *    <jv>list2</jv>.add(<js>"bb"</js>);
074 *    <jc>// list2 contains: ["a", "bb", "ccc"] (sorted by length)</jc>
075 * </p>
076 *
077 * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5>
078 * <ul class='spaced-list'>
079 *    <li>All elements must be mutually comparable (or comparable via the comparator)
080 *    <li>Null elements are allowed only if the comparator supports them
081 *    <li>The list maintains sorted order at all times - you cannot insert at a specific index
082 *    <li>Calling {@link #set(int, E)} may cause the element to move to maintain sorted order
083 *    <li>This implementation is not thread-safe
084 * </ul>
085 *
086 * @param <E> The element type.
087 * @see SortedLinkedList
088 */
089public class SortedArrayList<E> extends AbstractList<E> implements RandomAccess {
090
091   private final List<E> list;
092   private final Comparator<? super E> comparator;
093
094   /**
095    * Creates a new sorted list using natural ordering.
096    *
097    * <p>
098    * Elements must implement {@link Comparable}.
099    *
100    * @throws ClassCastException if elements are not comparable.
101    */
102   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
103   public SortedArrayList() {
104      this((Comparator<? super E>)Comparator.naturalOrder());
105   }
106
107   /**
108    * Creates a new sorted list using the specified comparator.
109    *
110    * @param comparator The comparator to use for sorting. Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
111    */
112   public SortedArrayList(Comparator<? super E> comparator) {
113      this.comparator = assertArgNotNull("comparator", comparator);
114      this.list = new ArrayList<>();
115   }
116
117   /**
118    * Creates a new sorted list with the specified initial capacity using natural ordering.
119    *
120    * @param initialCapacity The initial capacity.
121    */
122   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
123   public SortedArrayList(int initialCapacity) {
124      this((Comparator<? super E>)Comparator.naturalOrder(), initialCapacity);
125   }
126
127   /**
128    * Creates a new sorted list with the specified initial capacity and comparator.
129    *
130    * @param comparator The comparator to use for sorting. Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
131    * @param initialCapacity The initial capacity.
132    */
133   public SortedArrayList(Comparator<? super E> comparator, int initialCapacity) {
134      this.comparator = assertArgNotNull("comparator", comparator);
135      this.list = new ArrayList<>(initialCapacity);
136   }
137
138   /**
139    * Creates a new sorted list containing the elements of the specified collection.
140    *
141    * <p>
142    * The elements are sorted according to natural ordering.
143    *
144    * @param c The collection whose elements are to be placed into this list.
145    */
146   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
147   public SortedArrayList(Collection<? extends E> c) {
148      this((Comparator<? super E>)Comparator.naturalOrder(), c);
149   }
150
151   /**
152    * Creates a new sorted list containing the elements of the specified collection.
153    *
154    * @param comparator The comparator to use for sorting. Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
155    * @param c The collection whose elements are to be placed into this list.
156    */
157   public SortedArrayList(Comparator<? super E> comparator, Collection<? extends E> c) {
158      this.comparator = assertArgNotNull("comparator", comparator);
159      this.list = new ArrayList<>(c);
160      Collections.sort(this.list, this.comparator);
161   }
162
163   /**
164    * Adds the specified element to this list in sorted order.
165    *
166    * <p>
167    * The element is inserted at the appropriate position to maintain sorted order.
168    * If there are equal elements, the new element is inserted after existing equal elements
169    * (maintains insertion order for equal elements).
170    *
171    * @param e The element to be added.
172    * @return <jk>true</jk> (as specified by {@link Collection#add(Object)}).
173    */
174   @Override
175   public boolean add(E e) {
176      int index = findInsertionPoint(e);
177      list.add(index, e);
178      return true;
179   }
180
181   /**
182    * Inserts the specified element at the specified position.
183    *
184    * <p>
185    * <b>Note:</b> The index parameter is ignored - the element is always inserted in sorted order.
186    * This method exists to satisfy the {@link List} interface contract.
187    *
188    * @param index Ignored - element is inserted in sorted order.
189    * @param element The element to be inserted.
190    */
191   @Override
192   public void add(int index, E element) {
193      // Ignore index - always insert in sorted order
194      add(element);
195   }
196
197   /**
198    * Adds all elements from the specified collection to this list in sorted order.
199    *
200    * @param c The collection containing elements to be added.
201    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this list changed as a result of the call.
202    */
203   @Override
204   public boolean addAll(Collection<? extends E> c) {
205      boolean modified = false;
206      for (E e : c) {
207         add(e);
208         modified = true;
209      }
210      return modified;
211   }
212
213   /**
214    * Adds all elements from the specified collection at the specified position.
215    *
216    * <p>
217    * <b>Note:</b> The index parameter is ignored - elements are always inserted in sorted order.
218    *
219    * @param index Ignored - elements are inserted in sorted order.
220    * @param c The collection containing elements to be added.
221    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this list changed as a result of the call.
222    */
223   @Override
224   public boolean addAll(int index, Collection<? extends E> c) {
225      // Ignore index - always insert in sorted order
226      return addAll(c);
227   }
228
229   /**
230    * Replaces the element at the specified position with the specified element.
231    *
232    * <p>
233    * <b>Important:</b> After setting the element, the list is re-sorted to maintain sorted order.
234    * The element may move to a different position if its sort order changed.
235    *
236    * @param index The index of the element to replace.
237    * @param element The element to be stored at the specified position.
238    * @return The element previously at the specified position.
239    * @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if the index is out of range.
240    */
241   @Override
242   public E set(int index, E element) {
243      E oldValue = list.remove(index);
244      add(element);  // Re-insert in sorted order
245      return oldValue;
246   }
247
248   /**
249    * Returns the element at the specified position.
250    *
251    * @param index The index of the element to return.
252    * @return The element at the specified position.
253    * @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if the index is out of range.
254    */
255   @Override
256   public E get(int index) {
257      return list.get(index);
258   }
259
260   /**
261    * Removes the element at the specified position.
262    *
263    * @param index The index of the element to be removed.
264    * @return The element that was removed.
265    * @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if the index is out of range.
266    */
267   @Override
268   public E remove(int index) {
269      return list.remove(index);
270   }
271
272   /**
273    * Returns the number of elements in this list.
274    *
275    * @return The number of elements in this list.
276    */
277   @Override
278   public int size() {
279      return list.size();
280   }
281
282   /**
283    * Returns the comparator used to order the elements in this list.
284    *
285    * @return The comparator, or <jk>null</jk> if natural ordering is used.
286    */
287   public Comparator<? super E> comparator() {
288      return comparator == Comparator.naturalOrder() ? null : comparator;
289   }
290
291   /**
292    * Finds the insertion point for the specified element using binary search.
293    *
294    * <p>
295    * If there are equal elements, the new element is inserted after existing equal elements
296    * to maintain insertion order for equal elements.
297    *
298    * @param e The element to find the insertion point for.
299    * @return The index at which the element should be inserted.
300    */
301   private int findInsertionPoint(E e) {
302      int index = Collections.binarySearch(list, e, comparator);
303      if (index < 0) {
304         // Element not found - convert to insertion point
305         return -(index + 1);
306      }
307      // Element found - find the last occurrence of equal elements
308      // and insert after it to maintain insertion order
309      int size = list.size();
310      while (index < size && comparator.compare(list.get(index), e) == 0) {
311         index++;
312      }
313      return index;
314   }
315
316   /**
317    * Compares the specified object with this list for equality.
318    *
319    * <p>
320    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if and only if the specified object is also a list, both lists have the same size,
321    * and all corresponding pairs of elements in the two lists are <i>equal</i>. Two elements <c>e1</c> and
322    * <c>e2</c> are considered equal if <c>(e1==null ? e2==null : e1.equals(e2))</c>.
323    *
324    * @param obj The object to be compared for equality with this list.
325    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the specified object is equal to this list.
326    */
327   @Override
328   public boolean equals(Object obj) {
329      if (obj == this)
330         return true;
331      if (!(obj instanceof List))
332         return false;
333      return list.equals(obj);
334   }
335
336   /**
337    * Returns the hash code value for this list.
338    *
339    * <p>
340    * The hash code of a list is defined to be the result of the following calculation:
341    * <p class='bcode'>
342    *    <jk>int</jk> <jv>hashCode</jv> = 1;
343    *    <jk>for</jk> (<jk>E</jk> <jv>e</jv> : <jv>list</jv>)
344    *       <jv>hashCode</jv> = 31 * <jv>hashCode</jv> + (<jv>e</jv> == <jk>null</jk> ? 0 : <jv>e</jv>.hashCode());
345    * </p>
346    *
347    * @return The hash code value for this list.
348    */
349   @Override
350   public int hashCode() {
351      return list.hashCode();
352   }
353
354   /**
355    * Returns a string representation of this list.
356    *
357    * <p>
358    * The string representation consists of a list of the list's elements in the order they are returned
359    * by its iterator, enclosed in square brackets (<c>"[]"</c>). Adjacent elements are separated by the
360    * characters <c>", "</c> (comma and space). Elements are converted to strings as by
361    * <c>String.valueOf(Object)</c>.
362    *
363    * @return A string representation of this list.
364    */
365   @Override
366   public String toString() {
367      return list.toString();
368   }
369}
370
